title: Smuggled items worth Tk 168cr seized in Nov
body: The Border Guard Bangladesh seized huge smuggled items worth Tk 168.38 crore from border regions and other strategic locations in November. The seized items included over 2kg of gold, 121 grams of silver, 17,234 saris, 21,338 three-piece/shirtpiece/chadar/blanket items, 27,450 ready-made garments, 9,740 metres of Than cloth, 3,40,380 cosmetics, and 6,564 pieces of imitation jewellery, said a press release on Tuesday. The force also seized 10,09,421 fireworks, 6,216 cubic feet of wood, 1,284kg of tea leaves, 11,479kg of betel nut, 66,546kg of coal, 12,890 cubic feet of stone, 597kg of yarn/current net, 15,178 plastic/electronic items, 445 mobile phones, 15,145 mobile displays, 73,564 glasses, 37,690.500kg of cumin, 4,970kg of sugar, 1,63,490kg of onion, 1,731kg of garlic, 4,680 packets of seeds, 6,320kg of fertiliser, 2,684 packets of pesticides, 485 litres of diesel, and 1,68,021 pieces of chocolate. During the month-long drive, BGB personnel seized 819 cows and buffaloes, 16 trucks/covered vans, 17 pickups/Mahendras, 4 tractors, 2 private cars/microbuses, 14 trolleys, 179 boats, 38 easy-bikes, 54 motorcycles, and 31 bicycles/vans. During the operations, BGB arrested 159 smugglers involved in drug and contraband trafficking. Besides, 137 Bangladeshi citizens and two Indian nationals were detained for illegal border crossing. The force also pushed back 403 Myanmar nationals attempting to enter Bangladesh illegally.
